mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: ... a rustic retreat in the park of the Château de Versailles built for Marie Antoinette in 1783 near the Petit Trianon in Yvelines, France. It served as a private meeting place for the Queen and her closest friends; a place of leisure. ... The hameau is the best-known of a series of rustic garden constructions built at the time ... . Such model farms, operating under principles espoused by the Physiocrats, were fashionable among the French aristocracy at the time. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hameau_de_la_Reine [work]
